LIMESTONE

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section][et_pb_section fb_built=”1″ _builder_version=”4.4.7″ custom_padding=”0px||0px|||” collapsed=”on” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_row column_structure=”1_3,2_3″ use_custom_gutter=”on” gutter_width=”2″ _builder_version=”4.4.7″ width=”90%” max_width=”95%” module_alignment=”center” custom_padding=”68px||29px||false|false” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_column type=”1_3″ _builder_version=”4.4.7″ border_width_right=”1px” border_color_right=”#ffffff” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_image src=”https://www.gmciltd.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/limestone.jpeg” title_text=”limestone” align_tablet=”center” align_phone=”center” align_last_edited=”on|tablet” _builder_version=”4.4.7″ custom_padding=”||0px|||” animation_style=”slide” animation_direction=”left” scroll_horizontal_motion=”0|50|50|100|4|0|0″ global_colors_info=”{}” filter_hue_rotate__hover_enabled=”off|desktop” filter_hue_rotate__hover=”31deg”][/et_pb_image][/et_pb_column][et_pb_column type=”2_3″ _builder_version=”4.4.7″ global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.4.7″ text_font=”Lato|300|||||||” text_text_color=”#004B4F” text_font_size=”19px” text_letter_spacing=”0.5px” text_line_height=”1.6em” custom_padding_tablet=”” custom_padding_phone=”20px||||false|false” custom_padding_last_edited=”on|phone” scroll_horizontal_motion=”0|67|67|100|4|0|-4″ text_text_color_tablet=”” text_text_color_phone=”” text_text_color_last_edited=”on|phone” text_font_size_tablet=”19px” text_font_size_phone=”17px” text_font_size_last_edited=”on|phone” text_orientation_tablet=”center” text_orientation_phone=”center” text_orientation_last_edited=”on|tablet” global_colors_info=”{}”]

LIMESTONE is sedimentary calcareous rock, made of natural calcite (CaCO3), which is lime (CaO) for commercial purposes after calcination. Much of it is later deposited as a calcareous in solution in sea water. As the internal state of the water improves, calcium carbonate is precipitated. For example, if CaCO3 rates are large, precipitation will result from a drop-in temperature or a shift in pH (acidity).

The essence of the limestone bed indicates differing purity, with magnesium leading to magnesium claystone or dolomitic limestone typically substituting for some of the calcium molecules. Calcareous dolomite is called calcareous dolomite calcite with more than 10 percent, and magnesium calcareous with 5 to 10 percent. It is coloured grey and easily removed in lumps. CaCO3 is accessible in grades from 92 to 96 percent.

More than 95% of calcium carbonate is known as high calcium limestone rock. Calcium recrystallized is well polished and used as a stone for decoration and construction. And it’s classified as “marble.”

We provide superior quality of Limestone which is available to our customers in various thickness and dimensions as demanded by the customers.

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][et_pb_row column_structure=”1_3,1_3,1_3″ use_custom_gutter=”on” gutter_width=”2″ _builder_version=”4.4.7″ width=”90%” max_width=”95%” module_alignment=”center” custom_padding=”6px||6px||false|false” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_column type=”1_3″ _builder_version=”4.4.7″ border_width_right=”1px” border_color_right=”#ffffff” global_colors_info=”{}”][/et_pb_column][et_pb_column type=”1_3″ _builder_version=”4.4.7″ global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.4.7″ text_font=”Lato|300|||||||” text_text_color=”#004b4f” text_font_size=”18px” text_letter_spacing=”0.5px” text_line_height=”1.6em” header_font=”|||on|||||” header_6_font=”Lato|700||on|||||” header_6_text_color=”#004b4f” header_6_font_size=”25px” header_6_line_height=”1.5em” custom_padding=”0px||||false|false” custom_padding_tablet=”|||20px|false|false” custom_padding_phone=”20px|||20px|false|false” custom_padding_last_edited=”on|tablet” scroll_horizontal_motion=”0|67|67|100|4|0|-4″ text_text_color_tablet=”” text_text_color_phone=”” text_text_color_last_edited=”on|phone” text_font_size_tablet=”19px” text_font_size_phone=”17px” text_font_size_last_edited=”on|phone” header_6_font_size_tablet=”24px” header_6_font_size_phone=”24px” header_6_font_size_last_edited=”on|desktop” text_orientation_tablet=”left” text_orientation_phone=”left” text_orientation_last_edited=”on|tablet” global_colors_info=”{}”]

Physical Properties
  • Quicklime and slaked lime
  • Soil conditioner
  • Solid base for many roads
  • Suppression of methane explosions
  • Calcium supplement for poultry
  • Increasing the alkalinity of purified water
  • Extracting iron
